## ðŸ’» Meet the Buoy!

HydroBot is an open-source floating buoy that checks nutrients and pollutants in moving freshwater like streams and rivers. It mixes robot parts, smart computer learning right on the buoy, and far-reaching wireless signals to watch specific spots and meet community needs. The system has four main parts: a motorized unit that uses paper test strips which change color in water; a built-in camera system to analyze those strips on the spot; a long-range radio to send data to online dashboards; and a solar-powered floating case to keep it running (paper citation).
